courseTitle: International Shipping and Supply Chain Management
courseDescription: Examines international freight transportation and terms for movement of international trade; focuses on improving supply chain relationships in the movement of international trade/directing the flow of information, materials and products.  (cross-listed with MSCM 610)
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of terms for movement of international trade
Management of information, materials, and products flow
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication within international trade environment
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Directing the flow of information, materials, and products

courseDescription: Examines the international business of shipping, commercial processes, maritime-related organizations, shipbuilding and repair, ship types and fleets, and commodity movement.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of shipbuilding and repair techniques
Familiarity with various ship types and fleets
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication within the shipping industry
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Coordinating with shipbuilding and repair teams

courseDescription: Covers role, functions, and types of international terminals and ports, including design and operation of general and specialized cargo handling facilities and offshore systems, port authorities, operational structures, and labor.
Technical and Digital Skills: Operational knowledge of international terminals and ports
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Collaboration with labor and operational structures

courseDescription: International law of the sea, maritime jurisdiction, regulation of shipping, carriage of goods, marine insurance, salvage, marine environmental law, safety at sea, and the Oil Pollution Act of 1990 are covered, along with other maritime laws.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of international law of the sea
Knowledge of the Oil Pollution Act of 1990
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Negotiation and dispute resolution in maritime scenarios
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical analysis of marine insurance policies

courseDescription: Port planning and competition, ports and ocean container shipping, port impacts, port users in theory, port operator costing and pricing, port carriers and shippers, government and maritime institutions, dockworkers, port environment and port performance evaluation.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Communication with government and maritime institutions
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Understanding of port carriers and shippers
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Coordinating with port users and shippers

courseDescription: An overview of international and U.S initiatives to ensure the security of vessels, cargo, people, and infrastructure within the maritime domain. In addition to the impacts of regulatory requirements on maritime commerce, the course also addresses maritime threats to the international economy (including maritime piracy and maritime terrorism), maritime coalitions , and state-of-the-art techniques and tools for safeguarding ocean0borne commerce. (cross-listed with MSCM 615)
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of regulatory requirements in maritime commerce
Knowledge of state-of-the-art techniques and tools for safeguarding ocean-borne commerce
Understanding of international and U.S initiatives to ensure maritime security
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to communicate threats and risks in maritime domain
Ability to communicate maritime security initiatives
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Assessment of impacts on maritime commerce
Analysis and interpretation of maritime security regulations
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Managing and mitigating risks in maritime commerce

courseDescription: This course explores the theoretical foundations of global supply chain partnerships and reverse logistics systems, and examines the practices, risks, and opportunities found in today's systems.  Fundamental tools and techniques are used to provide insights and solutions on how to best organize, manage, and optimize such systems to achieve sustainable performance. (cross-listed with MSCM 616)
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of global supply chain partnerships
Ability to use fundamental tools and techniques for system optimization
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Risk assessment in supply chain and logistics
Analyzing practices, risks, and opportunities in supply chain and logistics
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Management of supply chain partnerships and logistics systems
Organizing supply chain and logistics systems for sustainable performance

courseDescription: The course includes a review of the key elements of transportation such as: modes of transportation, transportation economics, and transportation technology and regulations.   The relationships between intermediaries, carriers and shippers are discussed, as well as company roles and operations within the transportation field, transportation sourcing and management, and transportation risk management.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Negotiation with intermediaries, carriers and shippers
Understanding of company roles and operations within the transportation field

courseTitle: Shipbuilding and Ship Repair Business Management
courseDescription: Examines the shipbuilding and ship repair industry from the perspective of industry economics, industry financial management and repair operations and acquisition processes.  Provides industry professionals with business management practices that shape the industry.
Technical and Digital Skills: Financial management in shipbuilding and repair
Understanding repair operations and acquisition processes
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Negotiation and persuasion in business deals
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Strategic planning in shipbuilding and repair industry

courseDescription: Examines the rise of Lloyd's and the London Insurance Market, the current maritime insurance market, priciples of insurance and law, Hull Insurance Law, cargo insurance, general average and salvage insurance.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of Lloyd's and the London Insurance Market
Knowledge of principles of insurance and law
Comprehension of general average and salvage insurance
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to interpret and communicate insurance principles
Ability to explain complex insurance terms and conditions
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Ability to analyze and interpret marine insurance laws
Critical evaluation of insurance market trends
Risk assessment and management in marine insurance
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Understanding and application of maritime insurance regulations

courseDescription: This course examines supply chain management, the integration of all activities associated with the flow of materials and information from product start to customers' receipt. Examples include order processing, warehousing, inventory management, transportation and logistics, and the costs and information systems supporting these activities. Particular attention will be paid to global logistics systems supporting port and maritime activities. Supply chain relationships can be improved through effective integration of management and via such technologies as the World Wide Web, electronic data exchange, and enterprise resource planning (ERP). (cross-listed with MSCM 641)
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analysis of materials and information flow
Management of product start to customers' receipt
Evaluation of port and maritime activities

courseDescription: Practical field experience in international maritime, ports and logistics related challenges through supervised investigation and analysis of a problem or a working internship within the port-related arena.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Problem-solving within the realm of maritime and port logistics

courseTitle: Selected Topics in Maritime and Port Management
courseDescription: The advanced study of selected topics not offered on a regular basis.
Designed to provide the opportunity for independent study under the guidance of a member of the faculty.
